title: Lions v Australia: Finn Russell, Sione Tuipulotu & Huw Jones start first Test
description: The British and Irish Lions will field an all-Scottish fly-half and centre trio for the first time in history when they play Australia in the opening Test on Saturday.
content:
The British and Irish Lions will field an all-Scottish fly-half and centre trio for the first time in history when they take on Australia in the first Test in Brisbane on Saturday.

title: Syrian president condemns Israel’s attacks on Damascus and vows to protect Druze community
description: Ahmed al-Sharaa thanks American, Arab and Turkish mediators as efforts to restore order in city of Sweida continue
content:
Syria’s interim president has condemned Israel for “wide-scale targeting of civilian and government facilities” after the Israeli military struck Damascus on Wednesday as it sought to intervene in clashes between the Syrian army and Druze fighters.

title: Australia team news: Tom Lynagh to start at fly-half in first Lions Test
description: Fly-half Tom Lynagh will emulate his father, the Wallaby great Michael, when he starts for Australia in Saturday's first Test against the British and Irish Lions.
content:
Fly-half Tom Lynagh will emulate his father, the Wallaby great Michael, when he starts for Australia in Saturday's first Test against the British and Irish Lions.

title: Labour MP Diane Abbott stands by racism comments
description: The veteran Labour MP was disciplined by the party last year over comments in a newspaper letter.
content:
She added: "Clearly, there must be a difference between racism which is about colour and other types of racism because you can see a Traveller or a Jewish person walking down the street, you don't know.

title: UK drivers warned of soaring charges to drop off passengers at airports
description: Most airports charge up to £7 for a brief stop and 11 of the 20 biggest have raised their fees, RAC analysis shows
content:
Car drivers have been warned of soaring charges at UK airports to drop off passengers this summer, while major European airports continue to allow motorists brief stops without charge.
